description: With Android Marshmallow Google launched Android App Links, a better way to connect Android apps with their website counterparts.
title: Get rid of the app-selection dialog with Android App Links

description: This is the third post in a series about sharing information between apps. In this post, E John Feig creates a public API that allows other apps to use our app to speak something out loud.
title: Android Intents Part 3 - Make your phone talk

description: Designing for non-touch users means ensuring two things: access and feedback. As always, it's a case of identifying user journeys and making sure they are achievable by your target users.
title: Having Trouble Focusing? A Primer on Focus in Android

description: Google Voice Interactions allow developers the ability to communicate directly with their users. If further interaction is necessary, the app can vocally communicate this information to the user with additional voice interactions.
title: Implementing Google Voice Actions

description: Instance ID provides a unique identifier for each instance of your app, enabling you to identify and track your app instances around the world.
title: Unique Ids - There’s a better way with Instance ID

description: RxJava’s Observable class has plenty of methods that can be used to transform the stream of emitted items. But there are other methods that do not change the stream of items in any way.
title: RxJava's Side Effect Methods

description: Paul Kinlan shows a way to handle intents encoded in web urls.
title: Triggering a native Share intent on Android from the web

description: Next in the series of articles on the app bar, Mark Allison adds some motion to our feature image transitions.
title: AppBar – Part 3

description: It's Getting Better, Especially With The Nexus 5X And 6P
title: Android Audio Latency In-Depth

description: The Dropbox mobile team is focused on innovation within the Dropbox app, constantly improving both the technical foundation and the user interface. Come build the future of Dropbox!
title: Android Software Engineer at Dropbox

description: Search View Layout like Lollipop Dialer
title: Search-View-Layout

description: Heavily modified TabLayouts with some interesting new features.
title: FlycoTabLayout

description: Google Play services 8.3 provide a greatly improved sign-in experience for developers that want to build apps that sign their users in with Google.
title: Improvements to Sign-In with Google Play services 8.3

description: Gradle plugin for Android to generate Assets.java based on assets folder.
title: Asset File Generator

description: Wolfram Rittmeyer and Pascal Welsch get reactive with a presentation on RxJava for Android.
title: Get Reactive

description: Fragmented podcast dives deeper into using Dagger for Android development.
title: Diving Deep with Dagger

description: Tor and Chet talk with Jim Miller from the Android System UI team. They chat about the new fingerprint feature in Android 6 Marshmallow (aka, "Nexus Imprint").
title: Android Developers Backstage: Episode 38

description: Huyen pops down to Highlands Ranch, CO to chat with Dave Smith, Google Developer Expert at being an expert, about learning Android, training, and things Android devs should know and should do to level up their game.
title: Android Dialogs: Dave Smith

description: Welcome to the Developer Show, where you can stay up to date on all the latest Google Developer news, straight from the experts.
title: The Developer Show Ep 002

description: Seven presentations from Øredev 2015 conference.

description: The Google Test Automation Conference (GTAC) is an annual test automation conference hosted by Google. This is the recording of the first day's presentations.
